body: Source actions are code actions that apply to the whole file. They are not exposed via `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` and must be requested explicitly.

comment_data.body: Why aren't these discoverable via `code_action()` ? Can we enhance `code_action()` ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,4 +81,41 @@ return {
     'typescript.tsx',
   },
   root_markers = { 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', 'package.json', '.git' },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds

comment_data.body:
The typescript language server only returns these code actions if they're specified in `context.only`.

So there's nothing to fix on the nvim side. The command implementation actually does use `code_action()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,4 +81,41 @@ return {
     'typescript.tsx',
   },
   root_markers = { 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', 'package.json', '.git' },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds

comment_data.body:
This is an extra interface. Configs generally shouldn't invent new interfaces. The `code_actions()` menu is already sufficient. If someone wants to map something, they can just call `code_action()` with the right parameters.

Dropping this also eliminates the `complete()` code, which makes this PR much smaller.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,4 +81,41 @@ return {
     'typescript.tsx',
   },
   root_markers = { 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', 'package.json', '.git' },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds
+      return vim.tbl_filter(function(action)
+        return vim.startswith(action, 'source.')
+      end, codeActionKinds)
+    end
+
+    local function complete(arg)
+      return vim.tbl_filter(function(action)
+        return vim.startswith(action, arg)
+      end, get_source_actions())
+    end
+
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_create_user_command(0, 'LspTypescriptSourceAction', function(opts)
+      local params
+      if #opts.fargs == 0 then
+        -- ask the server what available actions there are
+        params = {
+          context = {
+            only = get_source_actions(),
+          },
+        }
+      else
+        -- with a specific action, apply it immediately

comment_data.body:
> The typescript language server only returns these code actions if they're specified in `context.only`.

But why? Is it because `code_action()` is sending position info, or diagnostics info? Do we need a way to tell `code_action()` not to send that info?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -78,4 +81,41 @@ return {
     'typescript.tsx',
   },
   root_markers = { 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', 'package.json', '.git' },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds

comment_data.body: That is really just how they've implemented it. You can see the code checks it [here](https://github.com/typescript-language-server/typescript-language-server/blob/0a034dae6c777733f4c2f6d5b151c5ef781fb662/src/lsp-server.ts#L779) where `kinds` is populated from [context.only](https://github.com/typescript-language-server/typescript-language-server/blob/0a034dae6c777733f4c2f6d5b151c5ef781fb662/src/lsp-server.ts#L769). The [refactor and quickfix actions](https://github.com/typescript-language-server/typescript-language-server/blob/0a034dae6c777733f4c2f6d5b151c5ef781fb662/src/lsp-server.ts#L770-L775) on the other hand have an extra `!kinds` check which means they're always returned if `context.only` is not provided.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

   },
   root_markers = { 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', 'package.json', '.git' },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds

+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These are not discoverable
+    -- via the normal `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` so add a command that allows access to them.
+    local function get_source_actions()
+      local codeActionKinds = client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds

+    end
+
+    local function complete(arg)
+      return vim.tbl_filter(function(action)
+        return vim.startswith(action, arg)
+      end, get_source_actions())
+    end
+
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_create_user_command(0, 'LspTypescriptSourceAction', function(opts)
+      local params
+      if #opts.fargs == 0 then
+        -- ask the server what available actions there are

comment_data.body:
I wonder if `code_action()` should have a parameter that does something like this (except without the `source.` constraint) by default? That would Nvim core to provide a default mapping (`gra` or something else) so that these are always discoverable for all servers.

Meanwhile, this is a good change, thank you.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -93,4 +95,19 @@ return {
       return vim.NIL
     end,
   },
+  on_attach = function(client)
+    -- ts_ls provides code actions that have a prefix `source.` that apply to the whole file. These will only appear in
+    -- `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()` if specified in `context.only`.
+    vim.api.nvim_buf_create_user_command(0, 'LspTypescriptSourceAction', function()
+      local source_actions = vim.tbl_filter(function(action)
+        return vim.startswith(action, 'source.')
+      end, client.server_capabilities.codeActionProvider.codeActionKinds)

comment_data.body: I don't actually know how common this pattern is. I think in other language servers these would be workspace commands instead. That said, if other language servers do it, it might be nice to have.

comment_regular_data.body:
> They are not exposed via `vim.lsp.buf.code_action()`

Thanks for confirming that :)

title: feat(ts_ls): provide command to run source actions
